{"version":"0.3.1","markups":[],"atoms":[],"cards":[["card-markdown",{"cardName":"card-markdown","markdown":"

Best Practice: Dial First, then Pick Up.

Since 1 and 9 are no longer required to distinguish outside calls, the best way to avoid misdialing a number is to:
  • First enter the full number on the keypad
  • Then pick up the receiver (or hit the headset or speaker phone button)
This will prevent you from connecting to 85-4661, when you’re actually trying to contact (854) 661-1234.

Do my voicemail messages expire?

Yes, the policy states that all voicemails will expire after 30 days and will be deleted from the phone and Outlook.
If you want to keep voicemails longer than 30 days, you can save them to Worksite just like you would save an email.

Do my Jabber chats expire?

No, your Jabber chats will always be available unless you delete them.
Keep in mind that when you have a conversation with another person, there will be two copies of the chat created, one on your computer and one on theirs.

Where are my Jabber chats saved?

They can be found in a folder in Outlook.
It's an automatically created folder called "Cisco Jabber Chats"
If today is your first time using Jabber, it may take a few hours before the folder shows up in Outlook. You can try restarting your computer to speed up the process.

How do I add a speed-dial to the desk phone?

  • You can add speed-dial numbers by going to the Self-Care Portal and adding it from there.
    You can get to the Self-Care Portal by navigating to: https://ucportal.manatt.com/ucmuser/
  • You can find more info in this QRG: Self Care Portal QRG

How can Professionals forward their desk phones to their cell phones?

Professionals can forward their desk phone in two ways:
  • From the desk phone
    • Press the .. softkey
    • Press the Forward All softkey
    • Enter the 10-digit number you want to forward to
    • To turn off forwarding, press the Forward off softkey
  • From Jabber
    • From the main Jabber window, click on the gray phone icon on the bottom left
    • Choose Forward All…
    • Enter in the phone number to forward to
    • To turn off forwarding, click the bottom bar in the main window

As a receptionist, how do I turn on autoattendant at the end of the day?

  • You will use your desk phone to forward the main number directly to the auto-attendant phone number without ringing.
    Each office will have their own office-specific phone number.
    • Press the .. softkey
    • Press the Forward All softkey
    • Enter the autoattendant number for your office
    • To turn off forwarding, press the Forward off softkey
  • In the morning, anyone with access to the main line can turn off the call forwarding.

How do I hang up on a call from the computer or stop the screen share once I've started?

When you're in a call, you'll see the Jabber widget docked at the top of your screen with a hang up button that you can press when you're finished with the call.

If you are in a screenshare, the widget will also show a button to stop the screenshare.

Can I get an alert when someone logs into Jabber so I can chat with them?

Yes! You can set an alert on their contact by right clicking their name in your contact list and select "Alert when Available"

When they come online, you'll get a popup on your screen.

How do I Check My Professional's Call Status?

Check the number next to their name on your display (please see photo below).

If the professional IS NOT on the phone, the number circled will show 1, meaning that the first line is ringing.
If the professional IS on the phone, it will show 2,3, or 4 depending on how many other calls he may have on hold.


 

When a call comes in, these are the steps to pick up a call (from the Secretary/Admin QRG).
Answer Call on Attorney's Line 1
1. Pick up handset.
2. Press Left button on KEM for that professional.
3. Press top Right button (flashing amber) on main display to pick up the call.

After Step 2, The main display will look similar to what you see in the picture above.

How do I access the Self-Care Portal?

1. Go to https://ucportal.manatt.com/ucmuser/    
   
      -OR-        
    In Jabber, click the  and choose File | Options | Self Care Portal

2. Log in with your Manatt User ID and password.

In the Self-Care Portal you can:
•  Add Speed Dial numbers
•  Change Ring Settings
•  Forward calls to your mobile or home number (Professional only)
•  Add a cell phone number (Professional only)

How to Transfer a Caller to Voicemail

1. Press Transfer.
2. Dial the 6-digit Automated Attendant for your office from the list below.
    (e.g., 87-1000 for San Francisco, 84-1000 for Costa Mesa, etc.); wait until you hear just the beginning of the greeting.
3. When you hear the greeting begin, immediately dial the desired Manatt employee's 6-digit extension + #.
4. Press Transfer.

Automated Attendant By Office
AL Office    86-1000 
CH Office   84-1000
DC Office   82-1000
LA Office   81-1000
NY Office   85-1000
PA Office   83-1000 
SA Office   88-1000 
SF Office   87-1000

TIP: Add a Speed Dial for the 6-digit Automated Attendant for your office. You can assign it to Speed Dial 1 so it displays on your phone.
(Secretaries could also assign it to a button on the KEM - any Speed Dial from 8 through 19). See the Self Care Portal QRG for the steps.

How to Record an Out-of-Office Greeting ("Away Greeting")

1. Log into Voicemail.
2. Say Personal Options.
3. Press 2 (Record Greetings)
4. Press 2 (Away greeting)
5. Press 1 to record your greeting.
6. Record your greeting after the tone. When finished press #.
7. Press 1 to accept.
8. When prompted, press 1 to "turn on the Away greeting."

When you return, log into voicemail and press 7 to "turn off the Away greeting."

How to Reset your Voicemail PIN from Outlook

Your new voicemail PIN was sent to you in an email. If you cannot find it, you can reset the PIN in Outlook.
1. In Outlook, go to the File Tab.
2. Click on Info from the left column.
3. At the bottom of the page, click Manage Voicemail.
4. A browser window will open to the Outlook Web App.
5. Click on the Phone Tab from the left column.
6. Choose Reset my voicemail PIN...

Want a Voicemail saved more than 30 days?

File it to WorkSite. 
Just like a voicemail message accessed via the phone, each voicemail email is automatically deleted when it becomes 30 days old.   
To save for long-term, file the email to WorkSite.

Remember! Deleting a voice message from your email inbox also deletes it from your voice mailbox!

Where are my Jabber Chats saved?

In Outlook, look for a folder called "Cisco Jabber Chats", which contains all chats you’ve participated in before you last opened Jabber.
(NOTE: These are not automatically deleted. You must delete items from this folder manually, as needed.)

Access Voicemail from outside Manatt

To access your voicemail from an outside line, dial 888-710-0677 or 480-375-9822.
If checking voicemail from a different Manatt office:
  • From a UC phone, dial 10-0000, press the * key, and follow the prompts.

Dialing a Number Outside Manatt

Dial just the 10-digit phone number (e.g., 213-555-1212) - no “9”, no “1”, and no Client/Matter number.

How do I set different ringtones so that each of my attorney lines has a distinct ring?


1. Click the Applications button on the phone.
2. Use the Navigation Cluster to go to Settings, click the center of the Navigation Cluster to select Settings.
3. Use the Navigation Cluster to go to Ringtone, click the center of the Navigation Cluster to select Ringtone.
4. Each attorneys’ line will be listed, with the selected ringtone. Use the Navigation Cluster to select a line to change.
5. Use the Navigation Cluster to select a ringtone. Use the soft keys to play ring tone to preview it.
    When you have the ringtone you’d like, hit the Set button
6. After you’ve set each attorney line to a unique ringtone, hit the Exit button.

How can a Professional use the Hands Free Voice Commands?

Unified Communications has a great hands-free function. You can use the built-in voice commands to check voicemail, read your email, respond to emails, and even accept meeting invites.

There's a whole page of voice commands in the Voicemail in Detail QRG (link here).
Here's a few highlights you can try out right now…

 View your calendar -

  • Say "Calendar"
  • Say "Today's Calendar" or "Tomorrow's
    Calendar" or "Calendar for November 17th"
  • Say "I'll be 20 minutes late" to send an
    email to all attendees
  • Say "Next Meeting" or "Previous Meeting"
  • Say "Meeting Details"

 Check your voicemail -

  • Say "Voicemail"
  • Say "Delete"
  • Say "Call" to call the sender
  • Say "Rewind" to replay the message
  • Say "Next Message"

 Read your email -

  • Say "Email"
  • Say " Next Message"
  • Say "Next Unread"
  • Say "Delete"
  • Say "Flag for Follow-up"
  • Say "Reply" or "Reply All" and record an audio response
  • Say "Accept", "Decline", or "Tentatively Accept" for meeting invites

 To change the reading speed -

  • Say "Speed Up"
  • Say "Slow Down"
  • Say "Pause"
  • Say "Rewind" to repeat the last few words

How do I add a person to a call?

1. From a connected call that is not on hold, press Conference.
2. Press Active calls to select a held call.
3. Press Conference again to join the calls together.

Which Conference Call option should I use in which situation?

See the chart below to determine which calling system is best for your needs.
Please be sure to choose the most cost-effective option based on the size of your meeting. 

        

Click HERE to open a pdf version of this chart.

What should I expect to see in my inbox when I miss a call?


        

Click HERE to open a pdf version of this chart.

What does this thing do?
 


 When Jabber is running, the “Jabber Window” displays at the top edge of the monitor:
 
 Hover your mouse over it to display the full bar.
 
Click in the Search field and start typing the name of a Manatt employee or someone in your contacts.
Their name will display just below.
 
 Hover over the person's name to show action icons - click an icon to start either a Chat or a Call.
 


"}]],"sections":[[10,0]]}

This will prevent you from connecting to 85-4661, when you’re actually trying to contact (854) 661-1234.

Do my voicemail messages expire?

Yes, the policy states that all voicemails will expire after 30 days and will be deleted from the phone and Outlook.
If you want to keep voicemails longer than 30 days, you can save them to Worksite just like you would save an email.

Do my Jabber chats expire?

No, your Jabber chats will always be available unless you delete them.
Keep in mind that when you have a conversation with another person, there will be two copies of the chat created, one on your computer and one on theirs.

Where are my Jabber chats saved?

They can be found in a folder in Outlook.
It's an automatically created folder called "Cisco Jabber Chats"
If today is your first time using Jabber, it may take a few hours before the folder shows up in Outlook. You can try restarting your computer to speed up the process.

How do I add a speed-dial to the desk phone?

  • You can add speed-dial numbers by going to the Self-Care Portal and adding it from there.
    You can get to the Self-Care Portal by navigating to: https://ucportal.manatt.com/ucmuser/
  • You can find more info in this QRG: Self Care Portal QRG

How can Professionals forward their desk phones to their cell phones?

Professionals can forward their desk phone in two ways:
  • From the desk phone
    • Press the .. softkey
    • Press the Forward All softkey
    • Enter the 10-digit number you want to forward to
    • To turn off forwarding, press the Forward off softkey
  • From Jabber
    • From the main Jabber window, click on the gray phone icon on the bottom left
    • Choose Forward All…
    • Enter in the phone number to forward to
    • To turn off forwarding, click the bottom bar in the main window

As a receptionist, how do I turn on autoattendant at the end of the day?

  • You will use your desk phone to forward the main number directly to the auto-attendant phone number without ringing.
    Each office will have their own office-specific phone number.
    • Press the .. softkey
    • Press the Forward All softkey
    • Enter the autoattendant number for your office
    • To turn off forwarding, press the Forward off softkey
  • In the morning, anyone with access to the main line can turn off the call forwarding.

How do I hang up on a call from the computer or stop the screen share once I've started?

When you're in a call, you'll see the Jabber widget docked at the top of your screen with a hang up button that you can press when you're finished with the call.

If you are in a screenshare, the widget will also show a button to stop the screenshare.

Can I get an alert when someone logs into Jabber so I can chat with them?

Yes! You can set an alert on their contact by right clicking their name in your contact list and select "Alert when Available"

When they come online, you'll get a popup on your screen.

How do I Check My Professional's Call Status?

Check the number next to their name on your display (please see photo below).

If the professional IS NOT on the phone, the number circled will show 1, meaning that the first line is ringing.
If the professional IS on the phone, it will show 2,3, or 4 depending on how many other calls he may have on hold.


 

When a call comes in, these are the steps to pick up a call (from the Secretary/Admin QRG).
Answer Call on Attorney's Line 1
1. Pick up handset.
2. Press Left button on KEM for that professional.
3. Press top Right button (flashing amber) on main display to pick up the call.

After Step 2, The main display will look similar to what you see in the picture above.

How do I access the Self-Care Portal?

1. Go to https://ucportal.manatt.com/ucmuser/    
   
      -OR-        
    In Jabber, click the  and choose File | Options | Self Care Portal

2. Log in with your Manatt User ID and password.

In the Self-Care Portal you can:
•  Add Speed Dial numbers
•  Change Ring Settings
•  Forward calls to your mobile or home number (Professional only)
•  Add a cell phone number (Professional only)

How to Transfer a Caller to Voicemail

1. Press Transfer.
2. Dial the 6-digit Automated Attendant for your office from the list below.
    (e.g., 87-1000 for San Francisco, 84-1000 for Costa Mesa, etc.); wait until you hear just the beginning of the greeting.
3. When you hear the greeting begin, immediately dial the desired Manatt employee's 6-digit extension + #.
4. Press Transfer.

Automated Attendant By Office
AL Office    86-1000 
CH Office   84-1000
DC Office   82-1000
LA Office   81-1000
NY Office   85-1000
PA Office   83-1000 
SA Office   88-1000 
SF Office   87-1000

TIP: Add a Speed Dial for the 6-digit Automated Attendant for your office. You can assign it to Speed Dial 1 so it displays on your phone.
(Secretaries could also assign it to a button on the KEM - any Speed Dial from 8 through 19). See the Self Care Portal QRG for the steps.

How to Record an Out-of-Office Greeting ("Away Greeting")

1. Log into Voicemail.
2. Say Personal Options.
3. Press 2 (Record Greetings)
4. Press 2 (Away greeting)
5. Press 1 to record your greeting.
6. Record your greeting after the tone. When finished press #.
7. Press 1 to accept.
8. When prompted, press 1 to "turn on the Away greeting."

When you return, log into voicemail and press 7 to "turn off the Away greeting."

How to Reset your Voicemail PIN from Outlook

Your new voicemail PIN was sent to you in an email. If you cannot find it, you can reset the PIN in Outlook.
1. In Outlook, go to the File Tab.
2. Click on Info from the left column.
3. At the bottom of the page, click Manage Voicemail.
4. A browser window will open to the Outlook Web App.
5. Click on the Phone Tab from the left column.
6. Choose Reset my voicemail PIN...

Want a Voicemail saved more than 30 days?

File it to WorkSite. 
Just like a voicemail message accessed via the phone, each voicemail email is automatically deleted when it becomes 30 days old.   
To save for long-term, file the email to WorkSite.

Remember! Deleting a voice message from your email inbox also deletes it from your voice mailbox!

Where are my Jabber Chats saved?

In Outlook, look for a folder called "Cisco Jabber Chats", which contains all chats you’ve participated in before you last opened Jabber.
(NOTE: These are not automatically deleted. You must delete items from this folder manually, as needed.)

Access Voicemail from outside Manatt

To access your voicemail from an outside line, dial 888-710-0677 or 480-375-9822.
If checking voicemail from a different Manatt office:
  • From a UC phone, dial 10-0000, press the * key, and follow the prompts.

Dialing a Number Outside Manatt

Dial just the 10-digit phone number (e.g., 213-555-1212) - no “9”, no “1”, and no Client/Matter number.

How do I set different ringtones so that each of my attorney lines has a distinct ring?


1. Click the Applications button on the phone.
2. Use the Navigation Cluster to go to Settings, click the center of the Navigation Cluster to select Settings.
3. Use the Navigation Cluster to go to Ringtone, click the center of the Navigation Cluster to select Ringtone.
4. Each attorneys’ line will be listed, with the selected ringtone. Use the Navigation Cluster to select a line to change.
5. Use the Navigation Cluster to select a ringtone. Use the soft keys to play ring tone to preview it.
    When you have the ringtone you’d like, hit the Set button
6. After you’ve set each attorney line to a unique ringtone, hit the Exit button.

How can a Professional use the Hands Free Voice Commands?

Unified Communications has a great hands-free function. You can use the built-in voice commands to check voicemail, read your email, respond to emails, and even accept meeting invites.

There's a whole page of voice commands in the Voicemail in Detail QRG (link here).
Here's a few highlights you can try out right now…

 View your calendar -

  • Say "Calendar"
  • Say "Today's Calendar" or "Tomorrow's
    Calendar" or "Calendar for November 17th"
  • Say "I'll be 20 minutes late" to send an
    email to all attendees
  • Say "Next Meeting" or "Previous Meeting"
  • Say "Meeting Details"

 Check your voicemail -

  • Say "Voicemail"
  • Say "Delete"
  • Say "Call" to call the sender
  • Say "Rewind" to replay the message
  • Say "Next Message"

 Read your email -

  • Say "Email"
  • Say " Next Message"
  • Say "Next Unread"
  • Say "Delete"
  • Say "Flag for Follow-up"
  • Say "Reply" or "Reply All" and record an audio response
  • Say "Accept", "Decline", or "Tentatively Accept" for meeting invites

 To change the reading speed -

  • Say "Speed Up"
  • Say "Slow Down"
  • Say "Pause"
  • Say "Rewind" to repeat the last few words

How do I add a person to a call?

1. From a connected call that is not on hold, press Conference.
2. Press Active calls to select a held call.
3. Press Conference again to join the calls together.

Which Conference Call option should I use in which situation?

See the chart below to determine which calling system is best for your needs.
Please be sure to choose the most cost-effective option based on the size of your meeting. 

        

Click HERE to open a pdf version of this chart.

What should I expect to see in my inbox when I miss a call?


        

Click HERE to open a pdf version of this chart.

What does this thing do?
 


 When Jabber is running, the “Jabber Window” displays at the top edge of the monitor:
 
 Hover your mouse over it to display the full bar.
 
Click in the Search field and start typing the name of a Manatt employee or someone in your contacts.
Their name will display just below.
 
 Hover over the person's name to show action icons - click an icon to start either a Chat or a Call.

https://manatt-mission-log.ghost.io/admin

You will need to log in with your Manatt account to access the backend. Everyone should have received an invitation link, just ping Alex or Catherine if you need an invitation resent. Click and activate the account once the invitation arrives.

Projects

  1. a project overview page needs to have at least 3 tags: "projects", the client tag (e.g. "duke"), and the project tag (e.g. "telemedicine-strategy").
  2. if a post belongs to a project it shouldn't have the "projects" tag
  3. Basically if a post has a project's tag (e.g. accenture or duke), but not the projects tag, then it should show up as a post nested inside the post, like this

Clients

Once a tag is marked as a Client in Settings > Tags > Meta Data, they will automatically be added here: https://manatt-mission-log.ghost.io/tag/clients/

posts.html:
These are two interesting talks from a June '18 AI conference, featuring the Databricks team. They are hosted on vimeo.

  • HIPAA Compliant Deployment of Apache Spark on AWS for Healthcare
  • Building the Future of Drug Discovery Dr. Jeff Reid
  • The Power of Unified Analytics Ali Ghodsi

Ali is the CEO and co-founder of Databricks, responsible for the growth and international expansion of the company. Ali was one of the original creators of open source project, Apache Spark, and ideas from his academic research in the areas of resource management and scheduling and data caching have been applied to Apache Mesos and Apache Hadoop. Ali received his MBA from Mid-Sweden University in 2003 and PhD from KTH/Royal Institute of Technology in Sweden in 2006 in the area of Distributed Computing

When I tried to use the Vimeo embed codes, they did not show because of the video permission settings (You can choose if your vimeo video can be embedded on other sites.)

<div style="padding:56.25% 0 0 0;position:relative;"><iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/274279381" style="position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:100%;height:100%;" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe></div><script src="https://player.vimeo.com/api/player.js"></script>

But luckily, we can just bring their website inside of ours like this:
posts.plaintext:
These are two interesting talks from a June '18 AI conference, featuring the Databricks team. They are hosted on vimeo. * HIPAA Compliant Deployment of Apache Spark on AWS for Healthcare [https://vimeo.com/274279381] * Building the Future of Drug Discovery Dr. Jeff Reid [https://vimeo.com/274274654] * The Power of Unified Analytics Ali Ghodsi [https://vimeo.com/274267449] Ali is the CEO and co-founder of Databricks, responsible for the growth and international expansion of the company. Ali was one of the original creators of open source project, Apache Spark, and ideas from his academic research in the areas of resource management and scheduling and data caching have been applied to Apache Mesos and Apache Hadoop. Ali received his MBA from Mid-Sweden University in 2003 and PhD from KTH/Royal Institute of Technology in Sweden in 2006 in the area of Distributed Computing When I tried to use the Vimeo embed codes, they did not show because of the video permission settings (You can choose if your vimeo video can be embedded on other sites.)
But luckily, we can just bring their website inside of ours like this: https://databricks.com/sparkaisummit/north-america/2018-spark-summit-ai-keynotes-2

posts.title: June New York Convener's Meeting
posts.mobiledoc:
{"version":"0.3.1","markups":[],"atoms":[],"cards":[["card-markdown",{"cardName":"card-markdown","markdown":"### 1. Children's Hospital Association - Anne Karl
### 2. Duke & John Hopkins - Jared Augenstein
* Develop research strategy for Schools of medicine
* Brought together Nobel Lauretes to panel
* Duke has largest clinical research Academic research organization, hundreds of trials
* Has grown up separately 
* Zerrin led work group on [precision medicine](https://ghr.nlm.nih.gov/primer/precisionmedicine/definition)
* How can they attract top tier talent, generate buzz for recruitment?

### 3. Hopkins project team - led by Tom Enders
* Based in Maryland, first official Manatt engagement with this team
* $6B Revenue Health System, losing rank in US standings from 3 --> 8
* Not as much revenue available to support level of research and innovation to maintain leadership in academic research space
* Challenging reimbursement structure
* How do they act more like a standard Academic Medical System, not standalone operating hospitals
* Only remaining faculty program in US just one track
* Complexity surrounds if they would change that approach
* Mary Keegan asks "Who is our client, are they an innovator?"
* Kevin Sour - Dean and CEO, former President from Duke, recently hired. Change Agent.
* Rob Cassigan - former CFO of Columbia University

### 4. North Carolina - Melinda update 
* Goal Integrate behavioral health into physical health infrastructure
* Created tailored plans for specific 
* Behavioral health tailor plans implemented year after MMC
* Legislature took a year but past in June 2018 that supports behavioral health integration, but does put restraints
* There will be governance issues to overcome during implementation

#### 4.1 Social determinants of health
* Signature initiaize for the secretary
* Led by Jocelyn, Anne? 
* CMS onboard with permitting savings under Managed Care waiver to launch social pilots
* Using medicaid funds in targeted ways to address social determinants and provide services
* Broad flexibility 
* Like the Tailored plans, there are a lot of implementation considerations
* How do we monitor and bundle

#### 4.2 Care management
* How to design care management transition, making advanced medical homes
* Place incentives on insurers to pass additional funds over time to providers
* Ben, Sharon, Edith, Emily, Mandy, Adam
* Jonah onboarding providers this summer

Tony Fiori - [Kentucky Colonel](https://www.kycolonels.org/)
"}]],"sections":[[10,0]]}
posts.html:
1. Children's Hospital Association - Anne Karl

2. Duke & John Hopkins - Jared Augenstein

  • Develop research strategy for Schools of medicine
  • Brought together Nobel Lauretes to panel
  • Duke has largest clinical research Academic research organization, hundreds of trials
  • Has grown up separately
  • Zerrin led work group on precision medicine
  • How can they attract top tier talent, generate buzz for recruitment?

3. Hopkins project team - led by Tom Enders

  • Based in Maryland, first official Manatt engagement with this team
  • $6B Revenue Health System, losing rank in US standings from 3 --> 8
  • Not as much revenue available to support level of research and innovation to maintain leadership in academic research space
  • Challenging reimbursement structure
  • How do they act more like a standard Academic Medical System, not standalone operating hospitals
  • Only remaining faculty program in US just one track
  • Complexity surrounds if they would change that approach
  • Mary Keegan asks "Who is our client, are they an innovator?"
  • Kevin Sour - Dean and CEO, former President from Duke, recently hired. Change Agent.
  • Rob Cassigan - former CFO of Columbia University

4. North Carolina - Melinda update

  • Goal Integrate behavioral health into physical health infrastructure
  • Created tailored plans for specific
  • Behavioral health tailor plans implemented year after MMC
  • Legislature took a year but past in June 2018 that supports behavioral health integration, but does put restraints
  • There will be governance issues to overcome during implementation

4.1 Social determinants of health

  • Signature initiaize for the secretary
  • Led by Jocelyn, Anne?
  • CMS onboard with permitting savings under Managed Care waiver to launch social pilots
  • Using medicaid funds in targeted ways to address social determinants and provide services
  • Broad flexibility
  • Like the Tailored plans, there are a lot of implementation considerations
  • How do we monitor and bundle

4.2 Care management

  • How to design care management transition, making advanced medical homes
  • Place incentives on insurers to pass additional funds over time to providers
  • Ben, Sharon, Edith, Emily, Mandy, Adam
  • Jonah onboarding providers this summer

Tony Fiori - Kentucky Colonel
posts.plaintext:
1. Children's Hospital Association - Anne Karl
2. Duke & John Hopkins - Jared Augenstein
 * Develop research strategy for Schools of medicine
 * Brought together Nobel Lauretes to panel
 * Duke has largest clinical research Academic research organization, hundreds
   of trials
 * Has grown up separately
 * Zerrin led work group on precision medicine
   [https://ghr.nlm.nih.gov/primer/precisionmedicine/definition]
 * How can they attract top tier talent, generate buzz for recruitment?

3. Hopkins project team - led by Tom Enders
 * Based in Maryland, first official Manatt engagement with this team
 * $6B Revenue Health System, losing rank in US standings from 3 --> 8
 * Not as much revenue available to support level of research and innovation to
   maintain leadership in academic research space
 * Challenging reimbursement structure
 * How do they act more like a standard Academic Medical System, not standalone
   operating hospitals
 * Only remaining faculty program in US just one track
 * Complexity surrounds if they would change that approach
 * Mary Keegan asks "Who is our client, are they an innovator?"
 * Kevin Sour - Dean and CEO, former President from Duke, recently hired. Change
   Agent.
 * Rob Cassigan - former CFO of Columbia University

4. North Carolina - Melinda update
 * Goal Integrate behavioral health into physical health infrastructure
 * Created tailored plans for specific
 * Behavioral health tailor plans implemented year after MMC
 * Legislature took a year but past in June 2018 that supports behavioral health
   integration, but does put restraints
 * There will be governance issues to overcome during implementation

4.1 Social determinants of health
 * Signature initiaize for the secretary
 * Led by Jocelyn, Anne?
 * CMS onboard with permitting savings under Managed Care waiver to launch
   social pilots
 * Using medicaid funds in targeted ways to address social determinants and
   provide services
 * Broad flexibility
 * Like the Tailored plans, there are a lot of implementation considerations
 * How do we monitor and bundle

4.2 Care management
 * How to design care management transition, making advanced medical homes
 * Place incentives on insurers to pass additional funds over time to providers
 * Ben, Sharon, Edith, Emily, Mandy, Adam
 * Jonah onboarding providers this summer

Tony Fiori - Kentucky Colonel [https://www.kycolonels.org/]

posts.html:
There are immediately available opportunities for artificial intelligence and cloud first development to support internal and external work. At Google Next '18, developers and system admins work towards increasing new innovation by supporting an open, democratized web.

You can experiment with the Natural Language Processing prototype developed to analyze large regulatory or research documents by visiting the NLP tab here and submitting content.

analyze large regulatory or research documents by visiting the NLP tab here and
